Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 7th overall pick, by Chicago (A) in 1965...
Injured on 8/2/1966 with a Concussion, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 9/6/1966 with a Jammed Finger, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit on 5/23/1968, off Bob Turley (MIN)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/24/1968, off Joe Decker (BOS)...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against Detroit on 9/13/1969...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/25/1971, hitting .474 with 4 HR, 8 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against Minnesota on 7/16/1972...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/24/1973, hitting .464 with 2 HR, 10 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/16/1973, hitting .478 with 2 HR, 9 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against California on 5/10/1975...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/5/1976, hitting .522 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by St. Louis on 2/1/1977 to a 4-year deal worth $8,000,000 per year...
Injured on 6/1/1977 with a Hyper Extended Knee, out for one week...
Was selected to the 1977 Allstar game...
